Board.name: ESP32 Dev Module
Board.menu.PartitionScheme.min_spiffs: Minimal SPIFFS (1.9MB APP with OTA/128KB SPIFFS)
Board.tools.wwwfiles.name: ESP32 Sketch Data Upload
Board.meta_esp32devkit.sentence: This debugger will require some the jumper configuration to be set correctly to allow debugging
Board.meta_esp32devkit.comment: Jumper settings can be found at the below link, and the 'https://zadig.akeo.ie/' tool is required to replace the USB Driver on Interface 0 with 'WinUSB'. Set vMicro > Debugger > 'Compiler Optimization' to > 'No Optimization' to ensure correct debugging (NOTE: This might cause compilation errors with certain code such as HardwareSerial.)
Board.meta_esp32prog.sentence: This debugger will require some wiring to connect it to your target ESP32 board
Board.meta_esp32prog.comment: Wiring can be found in the below image, and the 'https://zadig.akeo.ie/' tool is required to replace the USB Driver on Interface 0 with 'WinUSB'. Set vMicro > Debugger > 'Compiler Optimization' to > 'No Optimization' to ensure correct debugging (NOTE: This might cause compilation errors with certain code such as HardwareSerial.)

Board.meta_f2232mm.sentence: This debugger will require some wiring to allow it to function, and connect to your target ESP32 board
Board.meta_f2232mm.comment: Wiring can be found in the below image, and the 'https://zadig.akeo.ie/' tool is required to replace the USB Driver on Interface 0 with 'WinUSB'. Set vMicro > Debugger > 'Compiler Optimization' to > 'No Optimization' to ensure correct debugging (NOTE: This might cause compilation errors with certain code such as HardwareSerial.)

Board.meta_jlink.sentence: This debugger will require some wiring to connect it to your target ESP32 board
Board.meta_jlink.comment: Wiring can be found in the below image, and the 'https://zadig.akeo.ie/' tool is required to replace the USB Driver on Interface 0 with 'WinUSB'. Set vMicro > Debugger > 'Compiler Optimization' to > 'No Optimization' to ensure correct debugging (NOTE: This might cause compilation errors with certain code such as HardwareSerial.)
Board.meta_espc3usb.sentence: This debugger requires an ESP32C3 based board which supports USB Debugging
Board.meta_espc3usb.comment: Wiring can be found in the below image, the connection should appear as "USB JTAG debug unit" in device manager. Set vMicro > Debugger > 'Compiler Optimization' to > 'No Optimization' to ensure correct debugging (NOTE: This might cause compilation errors with certain code such as HardwareSerial.)
Board.meta_esps3usb.sentence: This debugger requires an ESP32S3 based board which supports USB Debugging
Board.meta_esps3usb.comment: Wiring can be found in the below image, the connection should appear as "USB JTAG debug unit" in device manager. Set vMicro > Debugger > 'Compiler Optimization' to > 'No Optimization' to ensure correct debugging (NOTE: This might cause compilation errors with certain code such as HardwareSerial.)
Board.meta_espc6usb.sentence: This debugger requires an ESP32C6 based board which supports USB Debugging
Board.meta_espc6usb.comment: Simply connect via USB, and ensure the WinUSB Driver is present on Interface 2 of the USB/JTAG Device shown in Zadig.
Board.meta_esph2usb.sentence: This debugger requires an ESP32H2 based board which supports USB Debugging
Board.meta_esph2usb.comment: Simply connect via USB, and ensure the WinUSB Driver is present on Interface 2 of the USB/JTAG Device shown in Zadig.
Board.tools.openocd.upload.pattern: "{upload.path}/{upload.cmd}" {upload.verbose} -s "{upload.path}/share/openocd/scripts/" -f "interface/{openocddebugger}" -f "board/{upload.openocdscript}" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading App :}" -c "telnet_port disabled; program {build.path}/{build.project_name}.bin {upload.binsector} reset; shutdown"
Board.tools.openocd.program.pattern: "{program.path}/{program.cmd}" {program.verbose} -s "{program.path}/share/openocd/scripts/" -f "interface/{openocddebugger}" -f "board/{upload.openocdscript}" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading App :}" -c "telnet_port disabled; program {{runtime.platform.path}/tools/partitions/boot_app0.bin} 0xe000" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading Bootloader :}" -c "program {{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin} {build.bootloader_addr}" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading Sketch :}" -c "program {{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bin} 0x10000" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading Partitions :}" -c "program {{build.path}/{build.project_name}.partitions.bin} 0x8000 reset; shutdown"
Board.tools.esp32c3openocd.upload.pattern: "{upload.path}/{upload.cmd}" {upload.verbose} -s "{upload.path}/share/openocd/scripts/" -f "interface/{openocddebugger}" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading App :}" -c "telnet_port disabled; program {{runtime.platform.path}/tools/partitions/boot_app0.bin} 0xe000" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading Bootloader :}" -c "program {{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin} {build.bootloader_addr}" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading Sketch :}" -c "program {{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bin} 0x10000" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading Partitions :}" -c "program {{build.path}/{build.project_name}.partitions.bin} 0x8000 reset; shutdown"
Board.tools.esp32c3openocd.program.pattern: "{program.path}/{program.cmd}" {program.verbose} -s "{program.path}/share/openocd/scripts/" -f "interface/{openocddebugger}" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading App :}" -c "telnet_port disabled; program {{runtime.platform.path}/tools/partitions/boot_app0.bin} 0xe000" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading Bootloader :}" -c "program {{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin} {build.bootloader_addr}" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading Sketch :}" -c "program {{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bin} 0x10000" -c "echo -n {****[vMicro]**** Uploading Partitions :}" -c "program {{build.path}/{build.project_name}.partitions.bin} 0x8000 reset; shutdown"
Board.recipe.hooks.prebuild.2.pattern: cmd /c if not exist "{build.path}\partitions.csv" if exist "{build.variant.path}\{build.custom_partitions}.csv" COPY "{build.variant.path}\{build.custom_partitions}.csv" "{build.path}\partitions.csv"
Board.recipe.hooks.prebuild.2.pattern.windows: cmd /c if not exist "{build.path}\partitions.csv" if exist "{build.variant.path}\{build.custom_partitions}.csv" COPY "{build.variant.path}\{build.custom_partitions}.csv" "{build.path}\partitions.csv"
Board.recipe.hooks.prebuild.4.pattern: cmd /c IF EXIST "{build.source.path}\bootloader.bin" ( COPY /y "{build.source.path}\bootloader.bin" "{build.path}\{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin" ) ELSE ( IF EXIST "{build.variant.path}\{build.custom_bootloader}.bin" ( COPY "{build.variant.path}\{build.custom_bootloader}.bin" "{build.path}\{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin" ) ELSE ( "{tools.esptool_py.path}\{tools.esptool_py.cmd}" {recipe.hooks.prebuild.4.pattern_args} "{build.path}\{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin" "{compiler.sdk.path}\bin\bootloader_{build.boot}_{build.boot_freq}.elf" ) )
Board.recipe.hooks.prebuild.4.pattern.windows: cmd /c IF EXIST "{build.source.path}\bootloader.bin" ( COPY /y "{build.source.path}\bootloader.bin" "{build.path}\{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin" ) ELSE ( IF EXIST "{build.variant.path}\{build.custom_bootloader}.bin" ( COPY "{build.variant.path}\{build.custom_bootloader}.bin" "{build.path}\{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin" ) ELSE ( "{tools.esptool_py.path}\{tools.esptool_py.cmd}" {recipe.hooks.prebuild.4.pattern_args} "{build.path}\{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin" "{compiler.sdk.path}\bin\bootloader_{build.boot}_{build.boot_freq}.elf" ) )
Board.recipe.hooks.prebuild.6.pattern: cmd /c if not exist "{build.path}\build_opt.h" type nul > "{build.path}\build_opt.h"
Board.recipe.hooks.prebuild.6.pattern.windows: cmd /c if not exist "{build.path}\build_opt.h" type nul > "{build.path}\build_opt.h"
Board.recipe.hooks.objcopy.postobjcopy.2.patte: cmd /c if exist "{build.path}\libraries\ESP_SR" if exist "{compiler.sdk.path}\esp_sr\srmodels.bin" COPY /y "{compiler.sdk.path}\esp_sr\srmodels.bin" "{build.path}\srmodels.bin"
cmd /c if exist "{build.path}\libraries\ESP_SR" if exist "{compiler.sdk.path}\esp_sr\srmodels.bin" COPY /y "{compiler.sdk.path}\esp_sr\srmodels.bin" "{build.path}\srmodels.bin"
Board.recipe.hooks.objcopy.postobjcopy.4.patte: cmd /c echo --flash-mode {build.flash_mode} --flash-freq {build.img_freq} --flash-size {build.flash_size} > "{build.path}\flash_args" && echo {build.bootloader_addr} {build.project_name}.bootloader.bin >> "{build.path}\flash_args" && echo 0x8000 {build.project_name}.partitions.bin >> "{build.path}\flash_args" && echo 0xe000 boot_app0.bin >> "{build.path}\flash_args" && echo 0x10000 {build.project_name}.bin >> "{build.path}\flash_args"

cmd /c echo --flash-mode {build.flash_mode} --flash-freq {build.img_freq} --flash-size {build.flash_size} > "{build.path}\flash_args" && echo {build.bootloader_addr} {build.project_name}.bootloader.bin >> "{build.path}\flash_args" && echo 0x8000 {build.project_name}.partitions.bin >> "{build.path}\flash_args" && echo 0xe000 boot_app0.bin >> "{build.path}\flash_args" && echo 0x10000 {build.project_name}.bin >> "{build.path}\flash_args"
Board.tools.esptool_py.upload.pattern_args: --chip {build.mcu} --port "{serial.port}" --baud {upload.speed} {upload.flags} --before default-reset --after hard-reset write-flash {upload.erase_cmd} -z --flash-mode keep --flash-freq keep --flash-size keep {build.bootloader_addr} "{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bootloader.bin" 0x8000 "{build.path}/{build.project_name}.partitions.bin" 0xe000 "{runtime.platform.path}/tools/partitions/boot_app0.bin" 0x10000 "{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bin" {upload.extra_flags}
Board.tools.esptool_py.program.pattern_args: --chip {build.mcu} --port "{serial.port}" --baud {upload.speed} {upload.flags} --before default-reset --after hard-reset write-flash -z --flash-mode keep --flash-freq keep --flash-size keep 0x10000 "{build.path}/{build.project_name}.bin"
Board.meta_all.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib-in-li: Libraries will be searched for in ALL Library files.
Identical to the Arduino IDE. Whilst comprehensive this can slow down deep search times.
Board.meta_top-level.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib: Libraries will be searched for in Library Root and Src Folders.
Works for most Libraries and improves Deep Search times.
Board.meta_none.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib-in-l: Libraries will NOT be scanned for other Library #includes.
All Library interdependencies must be resolved manually, but yields fastest deep search times.
Board.meta_all.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib-in-sk: All source files will be scanned for Libraries
Identical to the Arduino IDE. Whilst comprehensive this can slow down deep search times for large projects.
Board.meta_root.vm.preproc.lib-search.lib-in-s: All files in the Project Root will be scanned for Libraries
Speeds up deep search where libraries are only included from Project Root Source Files.
All files in the Project Root and Src folders will be scanned for Libraries
Speeds up deep search where libraries are only included from the Project Root and Src folders.
Board.meta_ino-code-only.vm.preproc.lib-search: Only INO files in the Project will be scanned for Libraries
Faster deep search if all libraries are included only from INO code.
Board.ide.builder.name: Arduino Builder
Board.ide.meta_custom_debugger.sentence: Provides a build that includes debug defines and will launch a custom debugger if one is provided.
Board.ide.meta_custom_debugger.paragraph: This is option is for advanced use. It is recommended that a pre-configured debugger be selected when available in this list. Usage: Optionally add a customer debugger to the project. A 'debugger_launch.json' file shares the same command syntax that is used by the VsCode debugger. Custom debuggers can be targeted at a board and/or variant and/or configuration name. IE: [variant].[configuration_name][.]debugger_launch.json
Board.ide.meta_vm_disable_opt_all.sentence: Disable compiler optimization for all sources:- Project, Library and Platform.
Board.ide.meta_vm_disable_opt_all.comment: After switching between 'No Optimization' and other optimization values, please click "Solution Clean" or switch off (or cycle) 'vMicro>Compiler>Shared Cache For Cores'. NOTE: Changing optimization settings can cause build errors or result in overly large programs.

BreakPoint.Name: SM_GE3222M V1.0.ino, line 641
BreakPoint.Message: Millis is currently {millis()}. This tutorial debug trace point prints a message every 250ms The break point property called 'Continue Execution' controls if code should pause here and wait for you to click 'Continue'. To stop debug, click stop debugging or close/stop the serial monitor. When debug ends, serial debug will continue to break/pause the mcu or transmit trace message, wifi debug will not. This breakpoint exists at the start of the loop() function, where you see a red dot. The red dot is a breakpoint. Edit the properties of a breakpoint by right clicking it or open the 'Debug>Other Windows>Breakpoint List' This breakpoint is automatically set by Visual Micro to demonstrate the Arduino debugger. Add your own breakpoints by placing the cursor on any code line and pressing F9. Press F9 again to delete the breakpoint. Read more about the Visual Micro debugger at https://www.visualmicro.com/page/Debugging-for-Arduino.aspx Take some time to learn about debugging, its worth it! To switch the demo breakpoint and other tips off, deselect Visual Micro>General>Tutorial Mode. Switch debugging off by changing from tool bar (Configuratin) from 'Debug' to 'Release'
